meanings.sent1: I weeded the garden to make space for the flowers to grow.
meanings.sent2: She weeded the flower bed to get rid of the pesky dandelions.
meanings.sent3: The garden gnome weeded out the intruding weeds with a smile.
meanings.sent4: She weeded the garden like a diligent caretaker, plucking out the unruly plants.
meanings.sent5: The act of weeding made the garden look neat and tidy.

meanings.definition: Remove unwanted items or people from (a group or collection)
meanings.sent1: He weeded out the old toys from his collection to make room for new ones.
meanings.sent2: The librarian weeded out the outdated books from the shelves.
meanings.sent3: The teacher weeded out the noisy students from the quiet reading corner.
meanings.sent4: She weeded out the unnecessary clutter from her room, creating a more spacious environment.
meanings.sent5: The process of weeding out the unnecessary items helped declutter the space.
